Section.Title: Description
Section.Paragraph: The AudioStream class is designed to allow simple low-latency gapless audio playback on Windows, even when the sample data being output isn't generated at a constant rate. Measures are taken to prevent audio artifacts that can occur from buffer underruns, and synchronization problems from sample data arriving too quickly or at a varying rate. See the overall description of the AudioStream library for further info.

FunctionMemberList.FunctionMemberListEntry: Opens an audio output device and prepares it for playback
Closes the previously opened audio output device
Creates an AudioBuffer object for supplying audio data

Places an AudioBuffer object in the list for playback. The buffer must not be accessed after this function is called, and the buffer is deleted automatically when playback is complete.
Performs a high quality sample rate conversion on raw sample data from one sample rate to another
